WorkItem.Description:
Hello,

When we access property of `Number.prototype` from a number literal in JavaScript, we can write like

    42..toString(); // "42"

and we can write this in TypeScript too.
But tsc compiles this code like

    42.toString();

and this code causes syntax error.
It seems a bug of compiler.
WorkItem.Summary: Incorrect Compilation of Accessing property from a number literal

Comments.Message: Thanks for reporting the issue - we'll take a look.
